title: システムの多言語対応の話題

conversation.ja_sentence: さっき電話でお話しされていたお客様、YC社様っておっしゃってましたよね。
conversation.en_sentence: The customer you were on the phone with earlier, is that company YC?

conversation.ja_sentence: はい、そうです。
conversation.en_sentence: Yes it was.

conversation.ja_sentence: YC社様で思い出したんですけど、以前に私も応対したことがありまして。
conversation.en_sentence: I just remembered that I did business with company YC before.

conversation.ja_sentence: あっ、そうなんですか？
conversation.en_sentence: Oh, I did not know that.

conversation.ja_sentence: はい、そのとき、「海外にあるクライアント端末で製品Aを使いたい」っておっしゃってたんですよ。
conversation.en_sentence: Back then, I was told they want to use product A with thin clients overseas.

conversation.ja_sentence: 今回は、海外ってお話しはされていませんでしたけど。
conversation.en_sentence: They did not mention anything about overseas this time round.

conversation.ja_sentence: じゃあ、まずは国内の拠点で検証して様子を見るのかもしれないですね。
conversation.en_sentence: Then they must have decided to try it out with the domestic ones first to see how it works.

conversation.ja_sentence: 私のときは、「製品Aは海外のパソコンでも動作しますか」と聞かれたんです。
conversation.en_sentence: When I was on the phone with them, I was asked if product A works on computers that are located out of the country.

conversation.ja_sentence: で、あまり深く考えずに、英語版ならあります、って答えたんですけど。
conversation.en_sentence: So I didn't give too much thought to it and replied that we have English versions.

conversation.ja_sentence: 海外というのは？
conversation.en_sentence: What countries are we talking about here?

conversation.ja_sentence: 中国、韓国、台湾、インドネシアとか、アジア方面だそうです。
conversation.en_sentence: China, Korea, Taiwan, Indonesia, mostly Asian countries.

conversation.ja_sentence: そのほかの国の言語への対応予定は、ありませんよねぇ。
conversation.en_sentence: We don't really have plans to make other language versions available, right?

conversation.ja_sentence: そう、私もそう思って、中国語、韓国語対応の予定はないですとお伝えしたんですよ。
conversation.en_sentence: Yeah, I thought so too, and I told them we would not carry Chinese and Korean versions.

conversation.ja_sentence: そうなんですか。
conversation.en_sentence: I see.

conversation.ja_sentence: 現時点ではその回答で、いいんじゃないですか。
conversation.en_sentence: I don't think anything was wrong with your reply at this moment.

conversation.ja_sentence: 国内拠点導入のお話が進めばですけど、もし気に入ったらこれを海外拠点でも使いたいというお話し、また出るかもしれないと思いまして。
conversation.en_sentence: Assuming the domestic introduction goes smoothly, they might start thinking about using it overseas as well.

conversation.ja_sentence: そうですね、覚えておきます。
conversation.en_sentence: That's true, I try to remember that.

conversation.ja_sentence: でも、対応できないですよね、技術的に。
conversation.en_sentence: But technically it would not work.

conversation.ja_sentence: それに、製品Aの機能の一部は、外国への輸出規制の対象になっているはずですよ。
conversation.en_sentence: Besides, some parts of product A are subject to export restrictions.

conversation.ja_sentence: ああ、そういうのもありますね。
conversation.en_sentence: Oh, I am aware of that.

conversation.ja_sentence: 製品Aは、日本国内専用仕様ということになりそうですね。
conversation.en_sentence: It sounds like product A should be used strictly in Japan.

conversation.ja_sentence: はい、仕方がないですね。
conversation.en_sentence: Yes, that's the only option we have.

conversation.ja_sentence: クーパーさん、他に何かアイディアはありませんか？
conversation.en_sentence: Mr. Cooper, do you have any other ideas?

conversation.ja_sentence: 日本人にもウケそうなものでお願いします。
conversation.en_sentence: Ones that appeal to Japanese people, please.

conversation.ja_sentence: そうですね。
conversation.en_sentence: Okay.

conversation.ja_sentence: 日本人はプレゼント交換は好きですか？
conversation.en_sentence: Do Japanese people like gift exchanges?

conversation.ja_sentence: プレゼント交換なら、小さい頃からやっているので馴染みがありますね。
conversation.en_sentence: Gift exchange are more familiar as we do them from when we are kids.

conversation.ja_sentence: それなら、ホワイトエレファントは好きかもしれないです。
conversation.en_sentence: If so, then a white elephant might be good.

conversation.ja_sentence: ホワイトエレファント、ですか？
conversation.en_sentence: What's a white elephant?

conversation.ja_sentence: 意味が全くわかりませんので教えてください。
conversation.en_sentence: I don't understand the meaning at all, would you please explain it?

conversation.ja_sentence: 簡単にいえば、ユニークなプレゼント交換という感じですね。
conversation.en_sentence: Basically, it is a unique gift exchange.

conversation.ja_sentence: 各自１０００円ほどの面白いプレゼントを用意します。
conversation.en_sentence: Each one of us prepares a unique gift that's about one thousand yen.

conversation.ja_sentence: そして誰が買ったものか分からないよう一箇所に集めて、一人ずつ順番にプレゼントを選んで開けていくんです。
conversation.en_sentence: Then we put those in one place without telling who bought it, and pick and open a gift one by one.

conversation.ja_sentence: それは、開ける方もドキドキして楽しいでしょうね。
conversation.en_sentence: Opening a gift must be exciting.

conversation.ja_sentence: それだけで終わりじゃないですよ。
conversation.en_sentence: That's not all.

conversation.ja_sentence: 二番目の人は新しくプレゼントを開けるか、前に開けられた他の人のプレゼントを奪う事ができます。
conversation.en_sentence: The second person can either open a new gift or steal a gift from another person.

conversation.ja_sentence: プレゼントを取られた人は、可哀想じゃないですか。
conversation.en_sentence: The people who had their gift taken away are unfortunate, aren't they?

conversation.ja_sentence: 他の人に自分が開けたプレゼントを盗まれたら、また新しくオープンするか盗むか選択できます。
conversation.en_sentence: If someone steals the gift you opened, you can pick a new one to open or steal another one.

conversation.ja_sentence: なるほど。
conversation.en_sentence: That makes sense.

conversation.ja_sentence: これを全員のプレゼントが確定するまでひたすらやるんですよ。
conversation.en_sentence: We continue doing that until everyone's gifts are decided.

conversation.ja_sentence: このゲーム、終わりは来るのですか？
conversation.en_sentence: Does this game ever end?

conversation.ja_sentence: ずっとプレゼントを盗み続けたら終わらないような気がしますが。
conversation.en_sentence: It sounds like it doesn't end if you keep stealing gifts.

conversation.ja_sentence: 一つのプレゼントを盗めるのは3回だけですので、大丈夫です。
conversation.en_sentence: One gift can be stolen up to three times, so that's fine.

conversation.ja_sentence: 最後までハラハラドキドキしてとても楽しいですよ。
conversation.en_sentence: It's exciting until the end of the game.

conversation.ja_sentence: プレゼントにかける値段もそんな高くないし、みんなの負担にもならないでしょうね。
conversation.en_sentence: The price for the gift isn't too expensive, and it will not be a burden to everyone.

conversation.ja_sentence: もし家に要らないものがあったらそれでもいいんですよ。
conversation.en_sentence: It's ok if you have something you don't need in your house.

conversation.ja_sentence: ホワイトエレファントというのは、要らないものという意味があるんです。
conversation.en_sentence: White elephant also means an unnecessary thing.

conversation.ja_sentence: 要らないものを処分しつつも、みんなで楽しもうという事です。
conversation.en_sentence: It is that we should have fun, while getting rid of things we don't need.

conversation.ja_sentence: 私はこのアイディアとても気に入りました。
conversation.en_sentence: I like this idea.

conversation.ja_sentence: 私もです。
conversation.en_sentence: Me too.

conversation.ja_sentence: 従業員５０人みんなでするのは大変そうなので、部署ごとでするという事にしましょうか？
conversation.en_sentence: It sounds difficult to do with all fifty employees, so should we do it by department?

conversation.ja_sentence: それだと各部署約１０人ほどなので丁度いいのではないですか？
conversation.en_sentence: If so, each department has ten people, so do you think that is just the right number?

conversation.ja_sentence: パーフェクトですね。
conversation.en_sentence: That sounds perfect.

conversation.ja_sentence: ルールが若干複雑なような気もするので、紙にまとめて配布しましょうか？
conversation.en_sentence: The rules sound a little bit complicated, so should we sum them up on a piece of paper and hand them out?

conversation.ja_sentence: ホワイトエレファントをする三週間前くらいに告知するというのはどうですか？
conversation.en_sentence: Why don't we notify everyone three weeks before we do the white elephant?

conversation.ja_sentence: そうしましょう。
conversation.en_sentence: Let's do that.

conversation.ja_sentence: ルールはゲームを始めれば、みんなすぐわかると思いますよ。
conversation.en_sentence: I think everyone will understand the rules once we start playing the game.

conversation.ja_sentence: そうですね。
conversation.en_sentence: Right.

conversation.ja_sentence: まさか日本の会社でホワイトエレファントが出来るなんて思ってもいなかったです。
conversation.en_sentence: I never thought I could do a white elephant at a Japanese company.

conversation.ja_sentence: とても楽しみになってきました。
conversation.en_sentence: I'm getting excited.

conversation.ja_sentence: 僕は、その日にアグリーセーターも着てきます。
conversation.en_sentence: I'll wear an ugly sweater on that day.

conversation.ja_sentence: じゃあ私もそうします。
conversation.en_sentence: I will too then.

title: 先輩社員への結婚の報告

conversation.ja_sentence: 引田さん、今お時間いいですか？
conversation.en_sentence: Ms. Hikida, do you have a minute?

conversation.ja_sentence: いいわよ、どうしたの？
conversation.en_sentence: Sure, what is it?

conversation.ja_sentence: まさか会社を辞めるだなんて言わないわよね？
conversation.en_sentence: Don't tell me that you are quitting the company?

conversation.ja_sentence: いえ、違います。
conversation.en_sentence: No, that's not right.

conversation.ja_sentence: 実は、来年春に結婚することが決まったので、報告しておきたいなと思って。
conversation.en_sentence: Actually, I wanted to inform you that I'm getting married next spring.
What...

conversation.ja_sentence: そうなの？
conversation.en_sentence: Really?

conversation.ja_sentence: 急だったけど、できちゃった婚なの？
conversation.en_sentence: That was sudden, but was is it shotgun marriage?

conversation.ja_sentence: いえ、妊娠はしてないですよ。
conversation.en_sentence: No, I'm not pregnant.

conversation.ja_sentence: そっか、それならよかったわ。
conversation.en_sentence: I see, that's good.

conversation.ja_sentence: え？
conversation.en_sentence: Pardon me?

conversation.ja_sentence: また社員が辞めて行くのかと思った。
conversation.en_sentence: I thought we are losing another employee.

conversation.ja_sentence: 私は、結婚後も働いて行くつもりなんですが・・
conversation.en_sentence: I was thinking to continue working even after getting married...

conversation.ja_sentence: とは言っても、子供が出来たらすぐに辞めるんでしょ。
conversation.en_sentence: But you will be quitting right after you get a child, right?

conversation.ja_sentence: 三ヶ月前に浦田さんが辞めたばっかりなのに。
conversation.en_sentence: Ms. Urada has quit only three months ago.

conversation.ja_sentence: こんなにも後輩が次々辞めていかれては、色々教えている私もやる気がなくなるわ。
conversation.en_sentence: I'm teaching so much, but I lose motivation if my employees keep quitting their jobs like this.

conversation.ja_sentence: 一生懸命教えても三年もしたら辞めちゃうものね。
conversation.en_sentence: Even if I teach with a passion, most of them quit their job after three years.

conversation.ja_sentence: 浦田さんの場合は、旦那さんの転勤だから仕方なかったのではないですか？
conversation.en_sentence: In Ms. Urada's case, her husband had a transfer so there was no other way, right?

conversation.ja_sentence: 一緒の事よ。
conversation.en_sentence: It's the same thing.

conversation.ja_sentence: 私はできる限り働き続けたいと思ってますから。
conversation.en_sentence: I'm hoping to keep working as long as I can.

conversation.ja_sentence: いずれ子供が出来た場合は、産休、育休を活用したいと思っています。
conversation.en_sentence: Someday when I have a child, I would like to take advantage of maternity leave and child care leave.

conversation.ja_sentence: あぁそうなのね。
conversation.en_sentence: I see.

conversation.ja_sentence: はい、私自身の親も共働きだったので、自分もそのつもりです。
conversation.en_sentence: Both my parents were working, so I'm thinking to do the same.

conversation.ja_sentence: そのつもりだったらいいんだけど。
conversation.en_sentence: If so then that's fine.

conversation.ja_sentence: まぁ、とりあえずおめでとう。
conversation.en_sentence: But anyways, congratulations.

conversation.ja_sentence: ありがとうございます。
conversation.en_sentence: Thank you.

conversation.ja_sentence: 村田さん、おはよう。
conversation.en_sentence: Good morning Murata-san.

conversation.ja_sentence: 小林君、おはよう。
conversation.en_sentence: Good morning Kobayashi-san.

conversation.ja_sentence: この間の会議お疲れ様。
conversation.en_sentence: Thank you for the meeting the other day.

conversation.ja_sentence: あれから海外進出のプラン考えた？
conversation.en_sentence: Did you come up with a plan on expanding abroad?

conversation.ja_sentence: うん、考えてはいるんだけど中々難しいね。
conversation.en_sentence: Hmm, I've been thinking but it's not easy.

conversation.ja_sentence: そうなんだよ。
conversation.en_sentence: I know, right?

conversation.ja_sentence: 今まで海外輸出なんてやったことがないからどこから考えればいいのかが分からなくて。
conversation.en_sentence: We've never exported abroad before so I don't know where to start thinking about it.

conversation.ja_sentence: そうなのよね。
conversation.en_sentence: I know.

conversation.ja_sentence: 私はまずはターゲットとゴールを設定しようと思うんだけど、中々定まらなくて。
conversation.en_sentence: I'm thinking of setting a target and a goal first but I can't quite make up my mind.

conversation.ja_sentence: 僕も同じく。
conversation.en_sentence: Same with me.

conversation.ja_sentence: 今回は実験的な輸出としてのプランを考えるとのことだけど、日本人をターゲットにするべきか、現地の人をターゲットにするべきかをまだ決めかねているんだ。
conversation.en_sentence: We are to think of a plan for the trial export this time but I haven't been able to decide if we should target Japanese people or the locals.

conversation.ja_sentence: それ次第でプランが全然変るもんね。
conversation.en_sentence: The plan will be completely different based on that.

conversation.ja_sentence: 現地の人をターゲットにしようと思ったんだけど、考えることたくさんでどうしたらいいか分からなくなっちゃったんだ。
conversation.en_sentence: I thought of targeting locals but there are so many things to think about that I don't know what to do.

conversation.ja_sentence: まだ正式な部署じゃないから現地調査の予算とかもないしね。
conversation.en_sentence: We're not an official department yet so we don't have a budget to conduct a field survey.

conversation.ja_sentence: そうなんだよ。
conversation.en_sentence: I know.

conversation.ja_sentence: やっぱり実験としては小宮さんの言うとおり、日本人ターゲットの方がいいのかな。
conversation.en_sentence: I think for a trial, it might be better if we target Japanese people as Komiya-san said.

conversation.ja_sentence: その方向で進めて、佐藤部長に相談してみようかな。
conversation.en_sentence: Let's go with that and maybe I'll discuss this with Sato-san.

conversation.ja_sentence: そうだね、僕はもう少し考えるけどその方が無難かもね。
conversation.en_sentence: Yeah, I'll think about it a bit more but that may be the safest bet.

title: 在庫切れの商品を入手したいお客様からの電話

conversation.ja_sentence: はい、A株式会社です。
conversation.en_sentence: This is A company.

conversation.ja_sentence: もしもし、私、山本と申します。
conversation.en_sentence: Yes, hello, this is Yamamoto.

conversation.ja_sentence: 御社のサイトを見てお電話したのですが。
conversation.en_sentence: I decided to call you after seeing your company's website.

conversation.ja_sentence: ありがとうございます。
conversation.en_sentence: Thank you for calling.

conversation.ja_sentence: どのようなご用件でしょうか。
conversation.en_sentence: What can I help you with?

conversation.ja_sentence: Bパズルが欲しくて、ネットで販売ページを見たんです。
conversation.en_sentence: I'm interested in one of your B puzzles that I saw on your online shop.

conversation.ja_sentence: でも、「在庫切れ」と書いてあったので。
conversation.en_sentence: However, it says on the page that it's sold-out.

conversation.ja_sentence: 次の入荷はいつ頃になりますか？
conversation.en_sentence: When will it be available again?

conversation.ja_sentence: Bパズルですか。
conversation.en_sentence: Are you inquiring about the B puzzle?

conversation.ja_sentence: 申し訳ありません。
conversation.en_sentence: I apologize for the inconvenience.

conversation.ja_sentence: こちらは、メーカー廃盤となっておりまして、残念ながら再入荷の予定がございません。
conversation.en_sentence: The manufacturer no longer produces it so we won't be able to stock up on this item any longer.

conversation.ja_sentence: 廃盤ですか...。
conversation.en_sentence: Discontinued, huh...

conversation.ja_sentence: 勉強になりそうだから、どうしても孫に買ってやりたいと思っていて。
conversation.en_sentence: I wanted to buy it for my grandchild because it seemed like an engaging game.

conversation.ja_sentence: 他のお店もいくつか見たんですが、見つからなくて。
conversation.en_sentence: I've tried other shops but I couldn't find any.

conversation.ja_sentence: そちらのお店なら、もしもお店にあれば、ちょっと遠いけど買いに行けるかな、と思ったんですが。
conversation.en_sentence: I'm willing to stop by your shop if you have it in stock even if it's a bit far.

conversation.ja_sentence: 店舗にもないでしょうか？
conversation.en_sentence: Could you inform me of any?

conversation.ja_sentence: そうですか...。
conversation.en_sentence: Well, about that ...

conversation.ja_sentence: 実はですね、ひとつだけございます。
conversation.en_sentence: We actually still have one available here.

conversation.ja_sentence: ただ、若干箱が潰れておりまして。
conversation.en_sentence: But the box has been somewhat flattened.

conversation.ja_sentence: そのために在庫から外していました。
conversation.en_sentence: We removed it from our stocks due to this reason.

conversation.ja_sentence: 中の商品には、まったく問題ないのですが。
conversation.en_sentence: There should be no problem with what's inside though.

conversation.ja_sentence: もし、このような状態でも気になさらないようであれば、お売りすることは可能ですが、いかがでしょうか？
conversation.en_sentence: We can put this back up on sale if you don't have a problem with the condition of the box.

conversation.ja_sentence: そうですか...。
conversation.en_sentence: I see.

conversation.ja_sentence: パズルには不良はないんですね？
conversation.en_sentence: So there shouldn't be a problem with the puzzle pieces inside?

conversation.ja_sentence: はい、それはございません。
conversation.en_sentence: That's right.

conversation.ja_sentence: じゃあ、それで構いません。
conversation.en_sentence: I don't mind.

conversation.ja_sentence: どうせ、箱は後で捨ててしまいますから。
conversation.en_sentence: I'm going to throw the box out anyway.

conversation.ja_sentence: 承知致しました。
conversation.en_sentence: Alright then.

conversation.ja_sentence: ご了承いただき、ありがとうございます。
conversation.en_sentence: Thank you very much for your understanding.

conversation.ja_sentence: では、その分送料はこちら持ちで、送らせていただきますね。
conversation.en_sentence: We'll have it delivered to you with the shipping fee covered.

conversation.ja_sentence: えっ、送っていただけるんですか？
conversation.en_sentence: Oh, you'll have it sent to me?

conversation.ja_sentence: それは助かります！
conversation.en_sentence: That would be a great help!

conversation.ja_sentence: 申し訳ありませんが、お支払いは代引きにしていただいても宜しいでしょうか？
conversation.en_sentence: Are you alright with cash on delivery as the method of payment?

conversation.ja_sentence: はい、大丈夫です。
conversation.en_sentence: Yes.

conversation.ja_sentence: FAXをお持ちでしたら、金額などを記載してご注文書を送らせていただきますが。
conversation.en_sentence: If you have a fax machine, I can send you the order invoice with the price included.

conversation.ja_sentence: はい、よろしくお願い致します。
conversation.en_sentence: Okay, I'll give you my number.

conversation.ja_sentence: 番号は、xxxx-xx-xxxxです。
conversation.en_sentence: My number is xxxx-xx-xxxx.

conversation.ja_sentence: わかりました、すぐ送りますので、どうぞよろしくお願いします。
conversation.en_sentence: I'll send the invoice to you as soon as possible.

conversation.ja_sentence: はい、お待ちしております。
conversation.en_sentence: Okay, I'll be waiting for it.

conversation.ja_sentence: それでは失礼致します。
conversation.en_sentence: Sure thing.

title: 会社に電気自動車を導入する件について

conversation.ja_sentence: みんな揃っているかな？
conversation.en_sentence: Is everybody here?

conversation.ja_sentence: はい、みんないます。
conversation.en_sentence: Yes, we have everyone now.

conversation.ja_sentence: では始めましょうか。
conversation.en_sentence: Shall we start, then?

conversation.ja_sentence: 今日は会社に電気自動車を導入する件です。
conversation.en_sentence: Today we are talking about introducing company electric vehicles.

conversation.ja_sentence: ちょうど今使用している車も古くなってきたことですし。
conversation.en_sentence: Our company cars are getting old by now.

conversation.ja_sentence: 何台ほど導入する予定ですか？
conversation.en_sentence: How many EVs are we planning to buy?

conversation.ja_sentence: まずは二台かなと思っています。
conversation.en_sentence: Initially, two cars.

conversation.ja_sentence: 皆さんもご存知の通り、ガソリン代は上がる一方ですし。
conversation.en_sentence: As you know, the petrol has been going up.

conversation.ja_sentence: 電気自動車だとその辺の心配はいらないかと思います。
conversation.en_sentence: We don't have to worry about the petrol if we have the EVs.

conversation.ja_sentence: 電気自動車だと、排気量も抑えられて、環境にも優しいですもんね！
conversation.en_sentence: Electric cars are eco-friendly as they have no emissions.

conversation.ja_sentence: それはそうだと思いますけど・・
conversation.en_sentence: Yeah, that's true, but..

conversation.ja_sentence: 電気代はものすごく上がるのではないですか？
conversation.en_sentence: I'm afraid the electric bill would go up enormously.

conversation.ja_sentence: それは間違い無いでしょう。
conversation.en_sentence: Definitely.

conversation.ja_sentence: けれど、それと同時にガソリン代も確実に減りますよね。
conversation.en_sentence: However, the petrol costs will be reduced as well.

conversation.ja_sentence: それに加え、燃費の良い車として、電気会社からクレジットがもらえるそうです。
conversation.en_sentence: In addition, we may receive a credit from the company for the efficiency.

conversation.ja_sentence: ですので、しばらくの間は、電気代の出費も抑えられると思っています。
conversation.en_sentence: So, I guess we can offset the electric bill for the time being.

conversation.ja_sentence: それはいいですね。
conversation.en_sentence: That sounds good.

conversation.ja_sentence: 最近は、色々なところで電気自動車用のチャージングステーションを見かけますし。
conversation.en_sentence: We can find electric car battery-charge stations in various places these days.

conversation.ja_sentence: 実は、使ってみたいなぁと思っていたところなんです。
conversation.en_sentence: I was thinking I should give it a go.

conversation.ja_sentence: 他にも燃費の良い車としての、ベネフィットはありますよ。
conversation.en_sentence: EVs have more advantages for the fuel efficiency.

conversation.ja_sentence: 例えば？
conversation.en_sentence: For instance?

conversation.ja_sentence: フリーウェイだってHOVレーンが使えます。
conversation.en_sentence: You can use a HOV lane on a motorway.

conversation.ja_sentence: と、なるとあの朝夕の渋滞に捕まることなくいけるということですね。
conversation.en_sentence: So, you can avoid the jam during the busy rush hours in the morning and evening, right?

conversation.ja_sentence: それは、嬉しいな。
conversation.en_sentence: That'll be great.

conversation.ja_sentence: 確かに！
conversation.en_sentence: Absolutely!

conversation.ja_sentence: 取引先のK自動車工場が、車を二台以上購入すると、割引をしてくれると言っています。
conversation.en_sentence: Our customer K Motor factory says they will give us a discount if we purchased more than two EVs.

conversation.ja_sentence: 会社の為にも、環境の為にも、電気自動車を導入するということで進めていきたいと思います。
conversation.en_sentence: So, I guess we've agreed to introduce electric vehicles for the sake of our company as well as the environment.

conversation.ja_sentence: 乗るのが楽しみですね。
conversation.en_sentence: I look forward to trying it.

conversation.ja_sentence: 私も楽しみです。
conversation.en_sentence: So do I.

title: 会社の飲み会について

conversation.ja_sentence: また今週の金曜日、会社の飲み会だってよ。
conversation.en_sentence: There's another company drinking party this Friday.

conversation.ja_sentence: また？
conversation.en_sentence: Again?

conversation.ja_sentence: 先週やったばかりじゃないか。
conversation.en_sentence: We just had one last week.

conversation.ja_sentence: 先週のは送別会で、今回は忘年会らしいよ。
conversation.en_sentence: Last week was a farewell party and it is the year-end party this time.

conversation.ja_sentence: 何で日本の会社はこんなに飲み会が多いんだ？
conversation.en_sentence: Why do Japanese companies have so many drinking parties?

conversation.ja_sentence: 勤務時間が終わってまで会社に縛られるのは本当に困る。
conversation.en_sentence: It's really a hassle to have your time committed to the company even after work hours.

conversation.ja_sentence: ごもっともだよ。
conversation.en_sentence: I know, right.

conversation.ja_sentence: 日本支社に働き始めて三年経つけど、いい加減嫌になってきたよ。
conversation.en_sentence: It's been 3 years since I started working at the Japan branch but I'm getting fed up with it.

conversation.ja_sentence: 最初の方は、楽しかったんだけどね。

conversation.ja_sentence: 僕の妻が、妊娠中だってこと知ってるだろう？
conversation.en_sentence: You know that my wife is pregnant, right?

conversation.ja_sentence: あぁ、つわりは落ち着いたかい？
conversation.en_sentence: Oh, has the morning sickness settled down?

conversation.ja_sentence: まだまだなんだよ。
conversation.en_sentence: No, not yet.

conversation.ja_sentence: それに２歳のわんぱく盛りの長男の面倒も見ないといけないだよ。
conversation.en_sentence: And I have to look after my 2 year old boy who's rambunctious.

conversation.ja_sentence: 先週の飲み会の時も、彼女は相当イライラしてたんだ。

conversation.ja_sentence: それは無理もないよ。
conversation.en_sentence: I don't blame her.

conversation.ja_sentence: 正直、彼女はアメリカに帰りたいと言っているよ。
conversation.en_sentence: Honestly, she is saying she wants to go back to the States.

conversation.ja_sentence: こんな思いをしてまで日本に居たくないって。
conversation.en_sentence: She doesn't want to go through all this and be in Japan.

conversation.ja_sentence: アメリカにいた時は、仕事後はすぐ家に帰って家族団欒を楽しんでいたのに。
conversation.en_sentence: When we were back in the States, I'd go home right after work and enjoyed family time.

conversation.ja_sentence: 日本に来てからは、喧嘩ばかりだよ。
conversation.en_sentence: But we've been fighting all the time since coming to Japan.

conversation.ja_sentence: 日本の飲み会は、自由参加と言いながら、暗黙の了解で強制参加だもんな。
conversation.en_sentence: They say drinking parties in Japan is free to join yet there is an unwritten rule that you're forced to attend.

conversation.ja_sentence: 本当馬鹿げてるよ。
conversation.en_sentence: It's so stupid.

conversation.ja_sentence: 無礼講と言いながらも、ずっと上司に気を使わないといけないし。
conversation.en_sentence: They say it's casual yet we have to always be attentive to the superiors.

conversation.ja_sentence: 勤務外手当が出るわけでもないし。
conversation.en_sentence: It's not like we get paid for this too.

conversation.ja_sentence: むしろ、飲み代でお金を徴収されるなんて。
conversation.en_sentence: Yet, they collect money for the drinking fee.

conversation.ja_sentence: 日本のシステムは全く理解できないよ。
conversation.en_sentence: I can't understand the system in Japan at all.

conversation.ja_sentence: ゲリー、君は今週は参加しなくていいと思うよ。
conversation.en_sentence: Gary, I don't think you have to attend this week.

conversation.ja_sentence: まずは、山道さんに相談してごらん。
conversation.en_sentence: You should first consult with Yamamichi-san.

conversation.ja_sentence: 僕からも、奥さんの状況なんかを話してあげるから。
conversation.en_sentence: I will let him know about your situation with your wife too.

conversation.ja_sentence: それだと助かるよ。
conversation.en_sentence: That would be helpful.

conversation.ja_sentence: 君の奥さんは、何も言わないのかい？
conversation.en_sentence: Doesn't your wife say anything?

conversation.ja_sentence: 僕の妻は日本人だから、こういう事には慣れてるんだよ。
conversation.en_sentence: My wife is Japanese so she's used to these kind of things.

conversation.ja_sentence: 本当は、良く思ってはないんだけどね。
conversation.en_sentence: She's actually not too fond of it though.

conversation.ja_sentence: もう諦めて、仕事なら仕方ないわねって。
conversation.en_sentence: She's given up and just says it can't be helped if it's work.

conversation.ja_sentence: それは、いいのか悪いのか・・
conversation.en_sentence: I don't know if that's a good thing or bad thing.

conversation.ja_sentence: 彼女のお父さんもそうだったらしいよ。
conversation.en_sentence: Her dad was like that too.

conversation.ja_sentence: そうなのか。
conversation.en_sentence: Is that right.

conversation.ja_sentence: 今度、僕の妻を君の奥さんに紹介しようか？
conversation.en_sentence: Should I introduce my wife to your wife next time?

conversation.ja_sentence: 愚痴る友達ができれば、気も紛れるだろうし。
conversation.en_sentence: I think she will feel better if she has a friend she can rant to.

conversation.ja_sentence: よろしく頼むよ。
conversation.en_sentence: Yes, please.

conversation.ja_sentence: もしもし。
conversation.en_sentence: Hello.

conversation.ja_sentence: 人事部の大山です。
conversation.en_sentence: This is Oyama from the HR department.

conversation.ja_sentence: 採用のことについてお話したいのですが、お時間宜しいでしょうか。
conversation.en_sentence: I would like to talk about employment, can you give me a moment?

conversation.ja_sentence: 何か、候補者の方にこれはできてほしい、という具体的なことはありますか。
conversation.en_sentence: Do you have anything in particular you would like candidates to be able to do.

conversation.ja_sentence: そうですね...。
conversation.en_sentence: Let's see...

conversation.ja_sentence: 学歴や職務経験について尋ねることは承知しています。
conversation.en_sentence: I understand you will be asking about academic background and job history.

conversation.ja_sentence: でも、この職位の一環として出張にいける人がまさに必要だと思います。
conversation.en_sentence: However, I think we need someone who is able to go on business trips as required for the position.

conversation.ja_sentence: そうですね。
conversation.en_sentence: You are right.

conversation.ja_sentence: 海外と国内の頻繁な出張が職務要件にありますね。
conversation.en_sentence: Frequent international and domestic business trips are part of the job requirement.

conversation.ja_sentence: では、その点に関心のない人は二次面接へ呼ばないようにしますね。
conversation.en_sentence: So please don't invite them to have a second interview if they are not interested in those.

conversation.ja_sentence: はい。
conversation.en_sentence: Alright.

conversation.ja_sentence: 宜しくお願いします。
conversation.en_sentence: Thank you.

conversation.ja_sentence: あ、私が来週月曜は休暇で不在なんです。
conversation.en_sentence: By the way, I will be out of the office next Monday.

conversation.ja_sentence: なので、その日にちを避けて面接を予定してください。
conversation.en_sentence: Therefore please avoid that date when scheduling interviews.

conversation.ja_sentence: わかりました。
conversation.en_sentence: I understand.

conversation.ja_sentence: よろしくお願いします。
conversation.en_sentence: Thank you.

conversation.ja_sentence: はい、では失礼します。
conversation.en_sentence: No problem, bye.

title: 会社の事務手続きのやり方について

conversation.ja_sentence: G社からの今年の支払調書、書留で送られてきたよ。
conversation.en_sentence: Company G sent us the payment records for this year by registered mail.

conversation.ja_sentence: え、わざわざ書留で？

conversation.ja_sentence: やっぱりそう思う？
conversation.en_sentence: Right?

conversation.ja_sentence: 普通郵便でいいよね。
conversation.en_sentence: Regular mail would have been fine.

conversation.en_sentence: I recall receiving it by regular mail before.

conversation.ja_sentence: 今年、どこかの会社から支払調書受け取った？

conversation.ja_sentence: 私もG社からのものが、今年最初だったんだけれど。

conversation.en_sentence: Did the law change without us knowing about it?

conversation.ja_sentence: 書留で送らなければならないっていう？

conversation.ja_sentence: どうなんだろうね。

conversation.en_sentence: He might have thought that it had to be registered mail and told the administration person to do it that way.

conversation.ja_sentence: 先に連絡をくれると、驚かなくて済むのにね。

conversation.ja_sentence: 新人さんだから、気が回らないんだろうね。

conversation.ja_sentence: 部長、今日はわざわざ時間を作っていただきありがとうございます。

conversation.ja_sentence: 復帰してくれるんだね、良かった！

conversation.ja_sentence: ありがとうございます。
conversation.en_sentence: Thank you very much.

conversation.ja_sentence: 産休の申請もしないといけないな。

conversation.ja_sentence: 6月出産なら4月から産休がいいのかな？

conversation.ja_sentence: はい、それぐらいからお休みいただけると助かります。

conversation.ja_sentence: 出産後はどれくらいで会社復帰希望なの？

conversation.ja_sentence: 半年後の12月ごろには復帰したいと思っています。

conversation.ja_sentence: ただこれまでのようにフルタイムは少し難しいかと。

conversation.ja_sentence: できたら時短勤務でお願いしたいです。

conversation.ja_sentence: ありがとうございます！
conversation.en_sentence: Thank you very much!

conversation.ja_sentence: 出産前でも体がきつかったら無理せず早退でも遅刻でもやってくれていいからな。

conversation.en_sentence: Again, thank you very much!

conversation.ja_sentence: 残念ながらそうなんですよ。
conversation.en_sentence: Unfortunately yes.

conversation.ja_sentence: はい、申し訳ありません。

conversation.ja_sentence: それと腹囲も100センチを超えています。

conversation.ja_sentence: 言い換えれば生活習慣さえ変えれば治るってことなんですよ。

conversation.ja_sentence: 私がそれを指導していけたらと考えています。

conversation.ja_sentence: 外食では何を召し上がることが多いですか？

conversation.ja_sentence: 麺類が好きなのでラーメン屋が多くなりますね。
conversation.en_sentence: I like noodles so I go to ramen stores often.

conversation.ja_sentence: だいたい唐揚げとか串カツとかフライ系が多いです。

conversation.ja_sentence: 自分でもよくないとはわかってるんですけどついつい。

conversation.ja_sentence: 厳しいことを言うようですが、この生活を続けていくと後5年で倒れるかもしれません。

conversation.en_sentence: And instead of ordering oily deep-fried snacks at the bar, ordering things like edamame and chilled tofu would be good.

title: 株主総会の手土産選定相談

conversation.ja_sentence: 高田さん、ちょっと相談していいですか？

conversation.ja_sentence: 何？
conversation.en_sentence: What?

conversation.ja_sentence: 来週の株主総会準備ミーティングで、総会時の手土産を選定したいんですけど。
conversation.en_sentence: At next week's meeting about the preparations for the shareholders' general meeting, I'd like to select the gift that we will give out in the general meeting.

conversation.ja_sentence: 手土産の候補をいくつか出しておこうかと思っているんですけど、いい案あります？
conversation.en_sentence: I'm thinking of presenting several potential gifts, but do you have any good ideas?

conversation.ja_sentence: 予算はどれくらい？
conversation.en_sentence: What's the budget?

conversation.ja_sentence: 出席株主一人当たり１０００円位が妥当かなと思ってます。
conversation.en_sentence: I think about 1,000 yen per attending shareholder should be about right.

conversation.ja_sentence: 去年の出席者が１００名くらいだったよね？
conversation.en_sentence: There were about 100 attendees last year, weren't there?

conversation.ja_sentence: はい、去年は１２２名参加でした。
conversation.en_sentence: Yes, 122 people attended last year.

conversation.ja_sentence: 去年は２００セット用意して、一人あたり１０４０円でした。
conversation.en_sentence: We prepared 200 gift sets last year, at a price of 1,040 yen per person.

conversation.ja_sentence: 去年の手土産って５００円の金券とお菓子だっけ？
conversation.en_sentence: What were last year's gifts again, a 500 yen gift voucher and some confections?

conversation.ja_sentence: はい、お菓子は会社のロゴをプリントした饅頭でした。
conversation.en_sentence: Yes, the confections were steamed buns that had the company logo printed on them.

conversation.ja_sentence: 評判はどうだったの？
conversation.en_sentence: And how were they received?

conversation.ja_sentence: 悪くはなかったんですけど、賞味期限が短かったのがネックかなと。
conversation.en_sentence: Not badly at all, the only issue was that they had a short expiration date.

conversation.ja_sentence: 余った分は社内で配ったのですが、来年もまた、っていう雰囲気じゃなかったです。
conversation.en_sentence: We shared the leftover buns amongst people in the company, but there wasn't a general feeling that we would do them again the next year.

conversation.ja_sentence: 高田さんは何がいいと思いますか？
conversation.en_sentence: What do you think would be good?

conversation.ja_sentence: 私、今期の業績下方修正で株主さんから結構電話でもきつく当たられるんだよね。
conversation.en_sentence: Well, due to the profit warning this quarter, plenty of shareholders have spoken quite harsh words to me over the phone.

conversation.ja_sentence: 今年の株主総会はちょっと雰囲気悪くなるかもだし、何か気持ち的に和らぐものがいいな。
conversation.en_sentence: Since there could be a bad atmosphere at this year's general meeting of shareholders, I was thinking something to calm emotions would be good.

conversation.ja_sentence: うわ、抽象的ですよ。
conversation.en_sentence: Wow, that's pretty abstract.

conversation.ja_sentence: 具体的に思い付きませんか？
conversation.en_sentence: Can you not think of anything specific?

conversation.ja_sentence: 鳩の形したサブレとかがいいな。
conversation.en_sentence: Something like dove-shaped shortbread might be nice.

conversation.ja_sentence: 何でです？
conversation.en_sentence: Why?

conversation.ja_sentence: 鳩は平和の象徴じゃない。
conversation.en_sentence: Well, a dove is a symbol of peace, isn't it.

conversation.ja_sentence: 私、荒れるなと思うミーティングとか決算説明会では、鳩の絵が入ったスカーフつけるようにしているのよ。
conversation.en_sentence: When I have to appear at a meeting I think is going to be rough, or a financial results briefing, I always make the effort to wear a scarf with a pattern of doves on it.

conversation.ja_sentence: 一種の験担ぎみたいなものなんだけど。
conversation.en_sentence: I mean, I guess it's kind of a superstition.

conversation.ja_sentence: 焼き菓子は万人受けするし、なにより賞味期限がながいからね。
conversation.en_sentence: Plus, everybody likes baked goods, and above all, they have long expiration dates.

conversation.ja_sentence: 高田さんがそんな験担ぎするのは意外ですね。
conversation.en_sentence: I didn't think you were so superstitious.

conversation.ja_sentence: 何でもいいからすがりたい時もあるのよ。
conversation.en_sentence: It doesn't really matter what it is, but sometimes you just want something to cling to.

conversation.ja_sentence: 切ないですね。
conversation.en_sentence: That sounds tragic.

conversation.ja_sentence: そんな話を聞いてしまったら、私も鳩の形したお菓子にしたくなってきましたよ。
conversation.en_sentence: After hearing your story, I've also come round to the idea of dove-shaped confectionery.

conversation.ja_sentence: 候補の一つとしてあげてみます。
conversation.en_sentence: I will present it as one of the potential choices.

conversation.ja_sentence: よろしくね。
conversation.en_sentence: Thanks.

title: オフィスの移転先見学

conversation.ja_sentence: 川上さんの会社の会議室はとても素晴らしいですね。
conversation.en_sentence: Kawakami-san, your company has a very impressive conference room.

conversation.ja_sentence: 私たちもこんなオフィスで働ければいいですよね。
conversation.en_sentence: I wish we could work at an office like that.

conversation.ja_sentence: オフィスといえばうちも移転先を探してるらしいぞ。
conversation.en_sentence: Speaking of an office, I know our company is looking for a new location.

conversation.ja_sentence: 本当ですか、ちょうど2階のテナントが空いてるんですよ。
conversation.en_sentence: Is that true, there is a vacant space on the second floor.

conversation.ja_sentence: ついでなのでご覧になっていただけませんか？
conversation.en_sentence: Since you are already here, would you like to take a tour?

conversation.ja_sentence: ちょうどテナント管理部のものが2階にいると思います。
conversation.en_sentence: I think the management happens to be on the second floor right now.

conversation.ja_sentence: じゃあ折角なので見学だけさせてもらうとしようか。
conversation.en_sentence: I guess I can tour take a tour since you offered.

conversation.ja_sentence: 川上さん、よろしくお願いします。
conversation.en_sentence: Kawakami-san, please take us there.

conversation.ja_sentence: なんだこれ、仕切りも何もないじゃないか。
conversation.en_sentence: What, there is nothing, not even a partition.

conversation.ja_sentence: なにもないワンフロアの空間ですね。
conversation.en_sentence: It's just an open floor with nothing.

conversation.ja_sentence: こちら弊社テナント管理部の桑田です。
conversation.en_sentence: This is Mr. Kuwata from our tenant managing department.

conversation.ja_sentence: はじめまして、桑田です。
conversation.en_sentence: Nice to meet you, I am Kuwata.

conversation.ja_sentence: S商事の江上です、よろしくお願いします。
conversation.en_sentence: I am Egami from S trading company, great to meet you.

conversation.ja_sentence: 同じくS商事の山田です、よろしくお願いします。
conversation.en_sentence: I am Yamada also from S trading company, pleasure to meet you.

conversation.ja_sentence: 早速ですが今はがらんどうの空間ですがこれから仕切りで理想の空間が作れます。
conversation.en_sentence: Let's get to the point, this empty area could be divided and turned into your ideal office space.

conversation.ja_sentence: 壁まである仕切りを使えば部屋のように分けることも可能ですよ。
conversation.en_sentence: If you use floor-to-ceiling partitions, it could be divided just like rooms.

conversation.ja_sentence: なるほどねえ、山田さんとこのフロアも元々はこんな感じだったんですか？
conversation.en_sentence: I see, Yamada-san, did your floor use to look like this too?

conversation.ja_sentence: はい、そうです。
conversation.en_sentence: Yes, it was.

conversation.ja_sentence: 要望を伺っていくつかの空間に仕切っていくんです。
conversation.en_sentence: We will divide the area according to our client's wish.

conversation.ja_sentence: 仕切りだけだと壁と違って音漏れの心配は無いんでしょうか？
conversation.en_sentence: Partitions aren't quite the same as walls, will I hear noises through the them?

conversation.ja_sentence: センシティブな会議の場合、社員に聞かれるのも困るんですよ。
conversation.en_sentence: It would become an issue if other employees could overhear meetings that discuss sensitive subjects.

conversation.ja_sentence: それはご心配なさらなくても問題ありません。
conversation.en_sentence: Don't worry, you will have nothing to worry about.

conversation.ja_sentence: 遮音機能の高いものを選ぶことで解決します。
conversation.en_sentence: We could easily solve this with sound-proof partitions.

conversation.ja_sentence: ダブルガラスタイプの分厚いものを選べば相当遮音性は高くなります。
conversation.en_sentence: The soundproof ability will even become much higher if you choose double-glass partitions.

conversation.ja_sentence: またサウンドマスキング仕様にすることでも解決します。
conversation.en_sentence: We could also use a noise masking system to solve this problem.

conversation.ja_sentence: これは空調音のような背景音をわざと流し音漏れを防ぐ仕組みです。
conversation.en_sentence: This system emits a soft, inconspicuous background sound to prevent noise leaks.

conversation.ja_sentence: いろいろあるんだねえ。
conversation.en_sentence: Seems like there is a variety to choose from.

conversation.ja_sentence: 他にも通常ドアの下には隙間があるんですがその隙間を防げば音漏れも少なくなります。
conversation.en_sentence: Also there is usually a gap between the door and the floor, and you could also fill this gap to keep the noises from leaking.

conversation.ja_sentence: そんなにいろいろと対策があるのなら問題はなさそうですね。
conversation.en_sentence: Looks like we will not have any issues with all these possible solutions.

conversation.ja_sentence: 弊社は機密書類が複数あるんですがその辺のセキュリティはどうなんでしょうか？
conversation.en_sentence: Our company stores some classified documents, and is there anything security system we could install?

conversation.ja_sentence: ご心配には及びません。
conversation.en_sentence: You have nothing to worry.

conversation.ja_sentence: ブラインドを部屋の内側に設置し部屋の中も見えないようにすることができます。
conversation.en_sentence: You could install blinds inside to give the room some privacy.

conversation.ja_sentence: もちろん部屋自体にセキュリティをかけることもできます。
conversation.en_sentence: Of course a security system could be installed in the room as well.

conversation.ja_sentence: それはどういうことですか？
conversation.en_sentence: What do you mean?

conversation.ja_sentence: もちろん今入ってこられたオフィスの入り口は通常セキュリティが施されています。
conversation.en_sentence: This very room you just entered normally has a security system at the door.

conversation.ja_sentence: 部外者の侵入を無くすためセキュリティカードをかざさなければ入室できません。
conversation.en_sentence: In order to keep outsiders from entering, the security card is required to open the door.

conversation.ja_sentence: そのカードに、さらに選ばれた人にだけこの部屋に入るための権限をつけることができます。
conversation.en_sentence: Additionally, a selected few could be given the authority to enter the room.

conversation.ja_sentence: そうするとそれ以外の社員は入り口は入れてもこの部屋には入れないということか。
conversation.en_sentence: Does it mean other employees aren't permitted to come in the room even if they want to?

conversation.ja_sentence: はい、そのとおりです。
conversation.en_sentence: Yes, exactly.

conversation.ja_sentence: 7階にも空きがあるのでよかったら見に行きましょう。
conversation.en_sentence: There is a vacancy on the seventh floor, and we could go check it out if you want.

title: 研究者の有期雇用について

conversation.ja_sentence: はー、次どうしよっかな。
conversation.en_sentence: Ahh, what should I do next?

conversation.ja_sentence: 後藤さん、今日上がりじゃないんですか？
conversation.en_sentence: Oh, I thought you were done for the day, Kento?

conversation.ja_sentence: いや、今の契約の後について考えてて。
conversation.en_sentence: Well, I just have my current contract on my mind.

conversation.ja_sentence: 後藤さんって、来年いっぱいでしたっけ？
conversation.en_sentence: Your contract will end at the end of next year, right?

conversation.ja_sentence: うん、現行プロジェクトが残り１年だから、次の長期案件の開始前に考えないとね。
conversation.en_sentence: Yes, the current project will be over in one year, so I should figure out what to do next before another long term project starts.

conversation.ja_sentence: あー、通常研究者って有期雇用だから、面倒ですよね。
conversation.en_sentence: Argh, that's the thing about researchers, usually with fixed-term contracts.

conversation.ja_sentence: 俺の科学研究費用もそろそろ切れるし。
conversation.en_sentence: My grant for Scientific Research will be expired soon, too.

conversation.ja_sentence: 科研費5年単位なの、どうにかなんないすかね、プロジェクト10年設定とかなのに。
conversation.en_sentence: Isn't there anything that could be done about that 5-year-term for KAKENHI fund, since most of the projects runs for 10 years or longer?

conversation.ja_sentence: まあ、そりゃ文科省のお決めになる事だから、な。
conversation.en_sentence: Well, that's all up to the great MEXT to decide, you know?

conversation.ja_sentence: でもこのN研究機構は総務省とか色々コネあるから研究もやりやすい方じゃないですか？
conversation.en_sentence: But we're lucky this C National Institute has connections to places like MIC, so we can work in a pretty good environment.

conversation.ja_sentence: 予算十分な研究所って少ないし、間違えて金集まんない所選んじゃうと悲惨ですよ。
conversation.en_sentence: There aren't many labs with sufficient budget so it would be pretty harsh if you accidentally choose one of those places that can't raise funds.

conversation.ja_sentence: ああ、そういえばしばらく前に、資金不足でシンガポールのでかいプロジェクト頓挫してたな。
conversation.en_sentence: That reminds me of a huge project in Singapore that was deadlocked because of lack of funds a while ago.

conversation.ja_sentence: ほらーって、もしかして、後藤さん、海外の研究所も視野に入れてるんですか？
conversation.en_sentence: See, oh, I might be wrong but are you looking at laboratories abroad as well?

conversation.ja_sentence: まあ、選択肢は広く、ね。
conversation.en_sentence: Well, I should keep my options open, right?

conversation.ja_sentence: 僕は日本に居たい人なんで、国分寺の駅から遠いのはやだなあ。
conversation.en_sentence: I'm a kind of guy who'd like to stay in Japan, and I don't want to get farther from Kokubunji station.

conversation.ja_sentence: はは、梶原お前それ、申請書の提出が楽なだけじゃん。
conversation.en_sentence: Ha-ha, just because it's easier to submit applications, isn't it, Yo?

conversation.ja_sentence: でも、まじめな話、日本の研究所も悪くないですよ、特許でかなり上手く運営してるK大学の研究所とか。
conversation.en_sentence: But, seriously, laboratories in Japan are not bad, like the one in K university which is doing pretty well with patents.

conversation.ja_sentence: そうだな、でもあそこみたいに国内で産学が上手くいってるケースはまだまだ珍しいよ。
conversation.en_sentence: That's true, but at the moment, it's a rare case within the country that university-industry research collaboration is working out like that.

conversation.ja_sentence: やっぱ、大学系のラボから選ぶならアメリカのCM大かUC大、かな。
conversation.en_sentence: After all, my choice out of labs in universities would be CM University or UC University in the US, I guess.

conversation.ja_sentence: アメリカ考えてるんなら、僕の大学同期がC工科大学に居て、アジア人多くて馴染みやすいって言ってましたよ。
conversation.en_sentence: If you're thinking of going to the States, a friend of mine from college is at C Institute of Technology now, and says it's pretty comfortable with bunch of Asian people.

conversation.ja_sentence: それにアジア系研究者が結構成果出してるって聞いてます。
conversation.en_sentence: He also says quite a few Asian researchers are producing results there.

conversation.ja_sentence: ああ、あそこは確かアファーマティブ・アクションしてないから、アジア人も多いんだろうな。
conversation.en_sentence: Uh-huh, I believe that institute doesn't support affirmative action, so that's probably why there are more Asians.

conversation.ja_sentence: 後藤さんなら優秀な研究者だし、英語も堪能だから、あっちでも大丈夫ですね。
conversation.en_sentence: You're an excellent researcher and a fluent English speaker, I'm sure you'd have no problem moving there.

conversation.ja_sentence: 奥さんも海外留学してた事あるんでしょ？
conversation.en_sentence: Your wife has also studied abroad, hasn't she?

conversation.ja_sentence: うん、でも家族と一緒って事になると言葉だけじゃないからなー。
conversation.en_sentence: Yeah, but it's not only the language matter you have to consider when you move abroad with your family.

conversation.ja_sentence: 家族全員が色々慣れなきゃだしな、職場とか、学校とか、生活習慣なんかも.......
conversation.en_sentence: My whole family have to get used to many things, like the work place, school, and lifestyle........

conversation.ja_sentence: それでも単身赴任は選択肢にないんですよね？
conversation.en_sentence: But moving there alone is not your option, right?

conversation.ja_sentence: 年単位の契約になるから、さすがに家族ここに置いては行けないさ。
conversation.en_sentence: Of course not, with a multi-year contract, I cannot leave my family here.

conversation.ja_sentence: どうせ慣れるのに苦労するなら、いっそヨーロッパで就職しちゃうのはどうですか、スウェーデンのK研究所とか。
conversation.en_sentence: If you'd have hard time getting used to things, you might as well find a job in Europe, like K Institute in Sweden.

conversation.ja_sentence: んー、K研究所は俺の専門だと難しいだろうな。
conversation.en_sentence: Hmm, K Institute probably wouldn't take me with my field of expertise.

conversation.ja_sentence: ドイツのM-P研究所はどうですか、あそこなら幅広い分野の研究者が居ますよね？
conversation.en_sentence: How about M-P Institute in Germany, they have researchers from a wide variety of fields, don't they?.

conversation.ja_sentence: あー、この間M-Pの年次報告読みながら、震えちゃいましたよー！
conversation.en_sentence: Aww, I was trembling as I went through their annual report the other day!

conversation.ja_sentence: ああ、でも、M-Pのポジションは薄給で知られてるし、長くは居られないだろ？
conversation.en_sentence: Well, it's well known that the positions at M-P are low-paid, so I wouldn't be able to stay for long, you see?

conversation.ja_sentence: うわ、M-Pで働くの実際に考えられる後藤さんが羨ましいですよ。
conversation.en_sentence: Whoa, I'm so jealous that you can actually think of working there.

conversation.ja_sentence: ドイツかあ、うーん、悪くないけどやっぱ給料がネックかなぁ。
conversation.en_sentence: Working in Germany, well, it sounds pretty good, but still the salary is a hurdle, I guess.

conversation.ja_sentence: その代わり、研究者として箔が付きますよ。
conversation.en_sentence: Instead, you can build reputation as a researcher.

conversation.ja_sentence: 大抵みんな５年ぐらいで辞めちゃって、他でペイのいい仕事してるみたいですし。
conversation.en_sentence: It seems that most people quit after 5 years or so and get high-paid jobs elsewhere.

conversation.ja_sentence: 俺がもっとデキるなら、絶対入りたいですよー！
conversation.en_sentence: I would love to join them if I was capable enough!

conversation.ja_sentence: 梶原、数分前に日本がいいって言ってたの、俺の聞き間違いかな？
conversation.en_sentence: Yo, I thought I heard you said that you'd like to stay in Japan, just a few minutes ago.

conversation.ja_sentence: いや梶原さん、あそこからオファーが貰えるんなら、手弁当でも速攻行きますよ！
conversation.en_sentence: Well, Kanto, if I got an offer from them, I'd just fly there right away, even without pay!

conversation.ja_sentence: おはようございます。
conversation.en_sentence: Good morning.

conversation.ja_sentence: おはようございます。
conversation.en_sentence: Good morning.

conversation.ja_sentence: どうされましたか？
conversation.en_sentence: How may I help you?

conversation.ja_sentence: 今日からここで働く者なんですが。
conversation.en_sentence: It's my first day today.

conversation.ja_sentence: そうですか、よろしくお願い致します。
conversation.en_sentence: Oh, nice to meet you.

conversation.ja_sentence: ありがとうございます。
conversation.en_sentence: Thank you.

conversation.ja_sentence: 駐車場利用許可の申請をしたくて。
conversation.en_sentence: I would like to apply for a parking permit.

conversation.ja_sentence: はい、わかりました。
conversation.en_sentence: Ok, sure.

conversation.ja_sentence: では、この申請用紙に必要事項を記入してお返し頂けますか？
conversation.en_sentence: Then, could you please fill out this form and hand it back to me?

conversation.ja_sentence: わかりました。
conversation.en_sentence: Okay.

conversation.ja_sentence: 明日から停められますか？
conversation.en_sentence: Will I be able to park from tomorrow?

conversation.ja_sentence: はい。
conversation.en_sentence: Yes.

conversation.ja_sentence: このステッカーをダッシュボードに置いてください。
conversation.en_sentence: Please leave this sticker on the dashboard.

conversation.ja_sentence: はい、わかりました。
conversation.en_sentence: Yes, sure.

conversation.ja_sentence: 所定の駐車場所を割り当てられるのですか？
conversation.en_sentence: Am I getting an allocated car park?

conversation.ja_sentence: いいえ、早い者勝ちです。
conversation.en_sentence: No, it's on a first come first serve basis.

conversation.ja_sentence: え、じゃあ停める場所がなかったらどうすればいいんですか？
conversation.en_sentence: Oh, but what happens if there aren't any spots to park?

conversation.ja_sentence: いえいえ、駐車場所はたくさんありますから大丈夫ですよ。
conversation.en_sentence: You don't need to worry too much, as there's plenty of available parking.

conversation.ja_sentence: それは良かった。
conversation.en_sentence: That's good to hear.

conversation.ja_sentence: 遠くから運転されるんですか？
conversation.en_sentence: Is it a long drive for you?

conversation.ja_sentence: そうですね、車でも1時間30分はかかりますね。
conversation.en_sentence: Yes, it would take one and a half hours even by car.

conversation.ja_sentence: そうですか。
conversation.en_sentence: I see.

conversation.ja_sentence: 駐車場は、朝の6:00から夜の12:00までです。
conversation.en_sentence: The car park opens between six o'clock in the morning and twelve o'clock at night.

conversation.ja_sentence: はい、わかりました。
conversation.en_sentence: Ok, I'll remember that.

conversation.ja_sentence: もし出張に行かれるなどで、車両を一晩駐車場に置かれる際はお知らせ頂く申請用紙の提出が必要です。
conversation.en_sentence: You will be required to submit a notification form if you plan on leaving your car in the parking area overnight, while you're away on business.

conversation.ja_sentence: はい、わかりました。
conversation.en_sentence: Ok, I got it.

conversation.ja_sentence: ステッカーは毎年更新が必要です。
conversation.en_sentence: The sticker needs to be renewed annually.

conversation.ja_sentence: あ、はい。
conversation.en_sentence: Ah, ok.

conversation.ja_sentence: 車種や住所、ナンバーなどの変更があればお知らせください。

title: ご愛用者プログラムについて
